English_pd_1_com_0text: I am Matthew, the fourth generation of the Miller family.
English_pd_2_com_0text: If you are interested in our story, then read on. The story is not long, it can be explained in a few words, and the time lasts for only a century.
English_pd_3_com_0text: The story originates from John and Mary on the farm, a young couple who accumulated wealth with their hard work.
English_pd_4_com_0text: Later, the economic crisis broke out, and the snow-white newspapers with the smell of ink swept the city. The price of crops fell as fast as the speed of people jumping off the building. The farm gradually couldn't support the family, and John and Mary died one after another.
English_pd_5_com_0text: In the second generation, Robert went to the city early to develop the automobile industry. Fortunately, due to the New Deal, his company did not go bankrupt directly during the crisis. William and Helen went to the front together, and died in the same foreign land.
English_pd_6_com_0text: Robert had two sons, Michael and David. William also left his daughter Susan before going to the front. The contact between these two generations was relatively weak, but not completely absent. Michael inherited his father's company, but did not inherit the courage and brilliance of his father who left the farm and came to the metropolis alone. The company was soon replaced due to the stagnation of productivity and technology, and then collapsed. David went to Vietnam, but like many others who traveled with him, he did not return. And countless young people who should not have been our enemies also lost their lives.
English_pd_7_com_0text: The only one who survived among the kids was Susan, my mother. She became an elementary school teacher and lived with her husband in a small apartment in a small city. I was their only child. Fortunately, they all lived to a ripe old age. The claws of war temporarily bypassed some people, and humans began to think more deeply about the meaning of peace.
English_pd_8_com_0text: My mother kept telling me when I was a child that war is a means for the country to protect itself, but it is also a clarion call to plunder the outside world. She didn't care about international political affairs, but the majority in her family had died for the devil. She never wanted me to become one of them. She persuaded me that participating in the war was not the only way to defend the country, nor was it necessarily the greatest contribution. What it did do, though, and can do effectively, was to take the lives of the young and the old. What would be the point of everything else if someone’s life was plundered?
English_pd_9_com_0text: I did listen to her advice and did not join the army. I successfully became a clerk in a government department. But guess why I am still standing here, in the grave, and talking to you right now?
English_pd_10_com_0text: You must have heard about the 911 incident in 2001. I remember clearly that I was dealing with my morning work at that time, but endless black smoke and flames engulfed our floor in an instant. I couldn't hold on for long and soon lost consciousness. The last person in the Miller family disappeared.
English_pd_11_com_0text: From 1901 to 2001. War is not happening all the time, but its profound impact is indeed everywhere. It has an invisible but mighty influence on a family, the home of living people, and has affected the lives of four whole generations. Besides the Millers, there are still numerous such families.
English_pd_12_com_0text: Has the war stopped in your world? I hope so, but it must not have. There are as many people who cherish peace in this world as there are people who fight for power, who are selfish and greedy, and who want to control the life and death of human beings to satisfy their own interests. This is a battle between the two sides with no end, and the price of the game is blood and fire, smoke and crying, the sea of corpses and the sea of fire. It is that even if you dedicate all your effort in the dark night, you will not be able to reach the dawn.
English_pd_13_com_0text: I have no other request for you in the future except that you may carry with you the memory of mine, Matthew Miller, and that of the rest of our family, to continue your original life before we met.
Chinese_pd_2_com_0text: 如果你对我们的故事感兴趣的话，那就看下去吧。故事不长，三言两语就能说清，时间也不长，仅仅有一个世纪。
Chinese_pd_3_com_0text: 故事起源于农场的John和Mary，一对年轻人用自己的勤劳积累下了财富。
Chinese_pd_4_com_0text: 后来经济危机爆发，雪白的油墨味的报纸席卷了城市。农作物的价格和排队跳楼的生命下坠的速度一样快，农场渐渐支撑不住，John和Mary也相继离世。
Chinese_pd_5_com_0text: 第二代人中，Robert早早去了城市发展汽车工业，幸运的是由于新政他的公司没有因为危机直接破产。William和Helen一同走上前线，也一同命陨他乡。
Chinese_pd_6_com_0text: Robert育有两子，Michael和David。William在赴往前线前也留下了女儿Susan。三人间联系比较淡薄，但也不是全无音讯。Michael继承了父亲的公司，却不具备父亲走出农场孤身一人来到大都市的勇气与头脑，公司很快由于生产力和技术的停滞被取代，随后破产。David前往越南战场，但就如同与他同行的许多人一样，他没有回来。并且，同样失去生命的还有无数本不该是我们敌人的年轻人。
Chinese_pd_7_com_0text: 三人中唯一活下来的是Susan，我的母亲。她成为了一名小学教师，与她的丈夫一同生活在小城市的一座小公寓里，我是他们唯一的孩子。幸运的是，他们都顺利活到了安享晚年的时候，战争的魔爪暂时绕开了一些人，而人类此时也开始更深入地思考和平的意义。
Chinese_pd_8_com_0text: 我的母亲在我小时候就不断地告诫我，战争是国家用来自保的手段，但也是向外界掠夺的号角。她不在意宏大层面上的事，但她的家族里已经有不止一人为此牺牲，她绝不想让我也成为其中之一。她劝说我，说参加战争并不是保家卫国的唯一方式，也未必是贡献最大的，但能够实打实地让人送命。人死了，其他的一切又还有什么意义？
Chinese_pd_9_com_0text: 我也确实听进了她的劝告，没有参军，在政府部门顺利当上了一名职员。可猜猜看，我现在为什么仍然会站在这里同你说话？
Chinese_pd_10_com_0text: 2001年的911事件，想必你在未来有所耳闻。我记得很清楚，那时我原本在处理早晨的工作，却有无边的黑烟和烈火转瞬间吞噬了我们所在的楼层。我没能坚持很久，很快就失去了意识，Miller家的最后一个人从此在地球上死亡。
Chinese_pd_11_com_0text: 1901年到2001年。战争并不是无时无刻在发生，但确实无处不在。它无形而有力地影响了一个家，一个有活生生的人的家庭，影响了四代人的一生。而在Miller之外，这样的家庭还有千千万万个。
Chinese_pd_12_com_0text: 战争在你们的世界停止了吗？希望如此，但一定没有。这个世界有多少珍爱和平的人，就会有多少争权夺利、自私贪婪、想要掌握人类生死用以满足自己私利的人。这会是一场没有终点的双方的博弈，而博弈的代价？是血与火，是硝烟与啼哭，是白骨堆积而成的尸山火海，是在黑夜里哪怕拼尽全力，也望不见黎明。
Chinese_pd_13_com_0text: 未来的你，我别无请求，只希望你能带着我，Matthew Miller，以及我们家其他家庭成员的记忆走下去，过好你来时世界的生活。
